item.title: post1
item.description: Background I’ve been focusing, really since the end of January, on working through the FuzzySecurity exploit development tutorials on the HackSysExtremeVulnerableDriver to try and learn some more about Windows kernel exploitation and have really enjoyed my time a lot. During this time, @ihack4falafel released some proof-of-concept exploits[1][2] against several Windows kernel-mode drivers. The takeaway from these write-ups, for me, was that 3rd party drivers that are responsible for overclocking, RGB light-management, hardware diagnostics are largely broken.
